name: Hilton Key Largo Resort

reviews.text: We had a nice stay here. I prefer a more quaint hotel, but they were all booked. Very nice room, recently renovated. Beach has nice private areas and open areas for sunbathing and activities. Nice dock...bring your boat and leave it docked for the stay. No complimentary breakfast but free coffee in the lobby...good enough.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: After reading some of the unfavorable reviews of this hotel, we were hesitant on staying here. My wife wanted to see the resort, so we walked up to the front desk and told them we would like to see the room and the beach because we heard that Tripadvisor reviewers had given this place not so good reviews. She had heard that and she called Ignacio to give us a tour. Ignacio, along with the front desk lady, were super helpful and very friendly. Ignacio showed us our room, a third floor room overlooking the gulf. This was an awesome view looking over the trees and out to the blue water and islands. If you want a good view, definitely request a third or fourth floor room. Otherwise, you will be looking onto the jungle on the first and second floor. We decided to take the room. The cost was 200 dollars but no parking or resort fees, so that was not a bad deal, given the view and the large room. Yes, the hotel is quite dated, but it has great ambiance. With the keys jungle surrounding it, we felt like we were more in Costa Rica or Panama than in the US. The room was clean for the most part and the beds were very comfortable. The furniture was decent and the decor tropical.
reviews.title: Much better than we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the beach, it is very small and narrow, but the sand was nice and the views were excellent. You can swim by the docks and pier and you can catch glimpses of fish and crabs. One guy said he had seen a manatee I the morning by the docks, but I saw none. The bar by the beach was great, and the margaritas were very potent for the price. They have water sports by the beach. They are costly and we did not rent any equipment.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but can be noisy

reviews.text: As for the restaurant Treetops. Great food and great ambiance. Jason , our server, was awesome and went out of his way to make our daughters twelfth birthday a hit. The food was a bit pricey, but look where you are. It is hard to match the views here at subset.
reviews.title: Convenient to Pennecamp Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we would return here. We enjoyed our stay. If you are looking for Keys comfort, this is your place. If you are looking for Four Seasons elegance, go elsewhere. Maybe Miami Beach!!!
reviews.title: Bad timing?
Hilton near Key Largo Florida
reviews.text: We have been going to Key Largo for the Dolphin Human Therapy for a few years. Have stayed at others hotels in the area. Last year while looking for a change of scenery, I discovered this hotel. Of course you have to request a water view, but for a nature lover, having a view of all those trees I was very pleased. Their Tree Top Restaurant is a bit pricey, but the view is awesome.

We stayed at the Key Largo Hilton Resort, excellent location and handy to everything we did, also very nice resort and beach area. The resort had a really great pool area and the restaurant was really good for breakfast and dinner.
reviews.title: Key Largo Vacation

reviews.text: Booked this resort as a stop over on our way to Key West....
reviews.title: Just okay...

reviews.text: I realize that options are limited on Key Largo. Considering the price tag I had much higher expectations. The photos make it look much nicer than it is in actuality. The noise from the highway isn't drowned out by the waterfall at the pool and is annoying. The pool area itself was under construction (in the family area) and had a noticeable sour smell. Rooms are rundown and could stand a good scrub down. I'm sitting on my bed in the Hilton writing this now.
reviews.title: Been there, enjoyed it and came back-not so good this time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't wait to check into the Hyatt!!
reviews.title: Nice, but maybe not as nice as the pictures make it to be

reviews.text: We stayed in Key Largo for a night on our way to Key West, had I known this place was so beautiful I would have stayed longer. Two gorgeous pools - one for adults, one for kids, two beaches you can snorkel at, fishing (they supply poles and tackle free) and an absolutely beautiful property and grounds. Very Relaxing!
reviews.title: Fantastic, Going Back !!

reviews.text: The staff was amazing and my bill all in was about $200 for the night. Definitely going back.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with an ocean (and sunset) view. Room was vast and has been recently refurbished but obviously not the bathroom which had a very, very small tub probably from the 70's which did not incite to take long baths... Staff is friendly and the price we payed very reasonable considering the overall experience. Only drawback, the location in the keys (Key Largo), an isle without any charm, at least from my point of view !
reviews.title: No complaints here.....

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a week at the Key Largo Grand. Some renovations were still ongoing, but we were not bothered by noise, nor really inconvenienced in any way. The fitness center was being finished, but a room had been set up with a few machines for anyone needing to feel the burn.
reviews.title: Don't let the name fool you.

reviews.text: Stayed with my husband and our two boys aged 8 and 6 for three nights on our travels down the keys.
reviews.title: Relaxing!
Vacation Stay
reviews.text: Had a lovely stay, room was clean although the patio furniture could do with updating.
Pool area was great and the pool bar and food was also very good.
reviews.title: How about..........no

reviews.text: Activities were on for the children which they really enjoyed.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely eal at tree tops restaurant whic was reasonable too.
reviews.title: Our 1.5hr away from home paradise

reviews.text: Yes this Hilton is DATED.....first of all you are in Key Largo....most of the Hotels in the Keys are DATED. It's a typical Beach hotel need I say more. With that said the rest we love. We love the BEACH and yes it actually HAS a Beach it's Key Largo. We get beach chairs and towels whenever we stay, we like that you can get Kayaks and SeaDos right off the Beach. A PingPong table under the trees, typical kids games Hilton Style, little Bar at the beach. Also the kids love the Pool with the waterfalls and it was a shame that we didn't see all the Iguanas walking around the pool area that we did last time. Also, you are close to all the restaurants in the area. It would be great if you always received one of the top floors when you checked in to have those great sunsets. Sometimes we luck out and get them other times we don't and even my husbands Hilton Honor Gold status can't move you when all those rooms are occupied. This last time we had a big Hedge as our view. Bummer, but the year before the sunsets were GORGEOUS. Overall it's a great Beach Hotel if you are prepared for what it is. Yes it would be lovely if it was renovated but I don't see that coming soon. We do go to the restaurant for the FREE breakfast (again b/c of his Hilton Status) we don't go to their restaurants otherwise. We like to go to all the local restaurants while traveling anyway. I rate the HOTEL as AVERAGE but the RESORT is EXCELLENT for it's Beach and amenities for families and tropical feel so therefore it's a VERY GOOD.
reviews.title: This Key Largo Hilton is all about LOCATION....

reviews.text: After reading all the reviews on here about this resort and comparing it to others in the area we decided to give this hotel a try. We knew we were here not to stay in a nice room but to enjoy the activities available at the resort. There was so much to do that we did not get to do everything. The kids loved the ping pong, snorkeling, jet skis, and kayaks. The fitness center offered plenty of room and equipment. The self-guided discovery tour was a lot of fun as well. We thought the service was good and we got everything we needed, even an extra blanket. One day while swimming we were offered free ice cream as well. However, breakfast was exactly the same every morning. Even the parking lot offered a lot of options with plenty of spacious and sheltered parking spaces, which was a bonus since it was storming the morning we left. The beach areas were very nice. The children swam in the calm waters right outside our room while we enjoyed the beautiful sunsets. We loved staying at the quieter south beach with plenty of shade and chairs.
reviews.title: We stayed here for the hotel activities, not the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is very basic. We had a first floor room, which was our preference. Most hotels we stay at offer a microwave but these rooms do not. Fresh popcorn at night is not an option here! The air conditioner could not control the high humidity in our room so our beach towels never dried unless left outside on the balcony. Then the next morning the 5 am storms would soak them again. A hotel dryer would be have been a nice amenity! Overall, the hotel was exactly what we expected but we especially enjoyed the many activities available at the hotel.
reviews.title: Worst Hilton experience

reviews.text: This Hilton owned and operated "RESORT" in Fl. keys was not found to be of a high standard. Room issues, Resort issues and not what a Hilton experience should be. If you want a Super 8 experience then feel free to stay here, if not try Marriott Resort in Key Largo where we went after two days at this Hilton
reviews.title: Not a Bad Hilton, Needs Minor Fixes

reviews.text: We stayed here two nights using points and I wasnt completely happy with the first floor room. We had two smaller children and you would think they wouldnt put us beside the guy outside singing and the bar. The room had rust on some of the fixtures and the bathroom wasnt very clean. And we noticed there were tons of sugar ants in the room on the furniture. The kids activities were good but the drinks were very expensive $26 bucks for 2 pina colodas..... Other than that it wasn't bad and the fitness center was excellent. It just needs kept up with newer furnishings and painted and maintained. And it you have a gold member who travels alot show up show them some loyalty and put them in an upgraded room away from the partiers as a sign of respect for staying with Hilton.....
reviews.title: Not the usual Hilton excellence

aka: Hilton Key Largo Hotel Key Largo
description: No other hotel offers a Florida Keys vacation experience quite like the Hilton Key Largo. This pristine, 13-acre resort sits on the best private beach in the upper Keys — and while it’s only an hour from Miami, you’ll feel worlds away, thanks to the sparkling white sand, lush tropical greenery and exciting outdoor activities.Guests at the Hilton Key Largo can enjoy as much excitement or relaxation as they like. Activities include world-class fishing and water sports, jet skis, wave runners, and para sailing. Nearby attractions include Dolphin Cove and the John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park, which is home to the only live coral reef in the continental United States. Kids love the hotel’s Scout About children’s program, and the whole family can enjoy the two heated swimming pools, fitness center and lighted tennis courts. Of course, there’s nothing wrong with spending hours just relaxing on the gorgeous beach and swimming in the crystal clear waters of the Gulf of Mexico. Or enjoying quiet moments in the handsomely appointed guest rooms, each of which is graced with a private balcony — opt for a water-view room and you’ll have a front-row seat for Key Largo’s spectacular sunsets. This is paradise, made easy.
